coherence.description: Logical flow and connection between ideas, demonstrating clear thought progression and relationships between different components

scoring_criteria.6: Generally coherent but with noticeable gaps
scoring_criteria.0: Complete lack of logical structure or organization

relevance.description: Alignment with task requirements and objectives, focusing on solving the intended problem without unnecessary divergence

scoring_criteria.10: Relevant and aligned with the task
scoring_criteria.8: Mostly relevant but with minor tangents
scoring_criteria.6: Relevant but with some off-topic elements
scoring_criteria.2: Irrelevant or not aligned with the task
scoring_criteria.0: Completely misses the purpose or solves wrong problem

helpfulness.description: The degree to which a response provides practical, actionable, and valuable assistance in addressing the user's needs, questions, or problems. This includes solution quality, actionability, proactiveness, user empowerment, and efficiency.

scoring_criteria.10: Perfect assistance: Complete, actionable solution with proactive guidance, clear explanations, and optimal efficiency. Fully addresses user needs and empowers future problem-solving
scoring_criteria.8: Strong assistance: Comprehensive solution with good actionability and proactive elements. Minor gaps in explanations or efficiency
scoring_criteria.6: Adequate assistance: Workable solution with basic guidance. Some gaps in completeness, actionability, or proactive support
scoring_criteria.4: Limited assistance: Partial or suboptimal solution. Significant gaps in guidance, proactiveness, or user empowerment
scoring_criteria.2: Poor assistance: Inadequate solution with minimal practical value. Major deficiencies in multiple aspects
scoring_criteria.0: No assistance: Provides no useful help or solution. Fails to address user needs or provides misleading guidance

readability.description: Ease of understanding the code's purpose and functionality, including appropriate naming conventions, formatting, and documentation

scoring_criteria.10: Exceptionally clear, self-documenting code with perfect formatting
scoring_criteria.8: Well-formatted, easy to read with clear variable/function names
scoring_criteria.6: Generally readable but with some unclear sections
scoring_criteria.4: Difficult to understand, poor formatting or naming
scoring_criteria.2: Very hard to read, confusing structure and naming
scoring_criteria.0: Completely unreadable, no formatting or documentation

maintainability.description: Ease of modifying, updating, and extending the code, including modularity, coupling, and cohesion considerations

scoring_criteria.10: Highly maintainable, perfectly modular with minimal coupling
scoring_criteria.8: Easy to maintain with good separation of concerns
scoring_criteria.6: Moderately maintainable with some technical debt
scoring_criteria.4: Difficult to maintain, high coupling between components
scoring_criteria.2: Very hard to maintain, poor structure and high complexity

best_practices.description: Adherence to industry standards, design patterns, and coding conventions specific to the programming language and context

scoring_criteria.10: Perfect adherence to all relevant best practices
scoring_criteria.8: Strong implementation of best practices with minor deviations
scoring_criteria.6: Generally follows best practices with some notable exceptions
scoring_criteria.0: Complete disregard for established best practices

error_handling.description: Robustness of error detection, prevention, and recovery mechanisms, including input validation and exception handling

scoring_criteria.10: Comprehensive error handling covering all edge cases
scoring_criteria.8: Strong error handling with minor gaps in coverage
scoring_criteria.6: Basic error handling for common cases
scoring_criteria.4: Minimal error handling with significant gaps

technical_context_awareness.description: Understanding and appropriate handling of the broader system context, including performance implications, security considerations, and integration requirements

scoring_criteria.10: Perfect awareness and handling of all technical contextual factors
scoring_criteria.8: Strong consideration of system context with minor oversights
scoring_criteria.6: Basic awareness of technical context with some missed considerations
scoring_criteria.4: Limited consideration of broader technical context
scoring_criteria.2: Poor understanding of system technical context
scoring_criteria.0: Complete disregard for system technical context

conversational_context_awareness.description: The ability to maintain and utilize conversation history, remember previous user inputs, and maintain contextual continuity throughout the interaction

scoring_criteria.10: Perfect recall and utilization of all previous conversation context
scoring_criteria.8: Strong awareness of conversation history with minor gaps
scoring_criteria.6: Basic awareness of immediate context but misses some historical details
scoring_criteria.4: Frequently loses track of previous context
scoring_criteria.0: Complete inability to maintain conversational context

file_context_awareness.description: Understanding and appropriate handling of provided files, attachments, and their contents, including proper interpretation of file formats and data structures

scoring_criteria.10: Perfect understanding and handling of all file contexts and relationships
scoring_criteria.8: Strong grasp of file context with minor oversights
scoring_criteria.6: Basic understanding of file context but misses some details
scoring_criteria.4: Limited understanding of file relationships and context
scoring_criteria.0: Complete inability to understand file context

code_style_consistency.description: Uniform application of coding styles, patterns, and conventions throughout the codebase, ensuring a cohesive and predictable structure

scoring_criteria.10: Perfect consistency in coding style throughout
scoring_criteria.8: High consistency with very few style deviations
scoring_criteria.6: Generally consistent code style with some variations

communication_style_consistency.description: Maintaining a consistent tone, vocabulary level, and communication style throughout interactions, including appropriate formality and technical depth

scoring_criteria.10: Perfect consistency in communication style and tone
scoring_criteria.8: High consistency with minor variations in tone
scoring_criteria.6: Generally consistent communication style with some fluctuations
scoring_criteria.4: Noticeable inconsistencies in tone and style

conciseness.description: Ability to convey information efficiently without unnecessary verbosity

scoring_criteria.10: Perfect balance of brevity and completeness
scoring_criteria.8: Mostly concise with minimal excess information
scoring_criteria.6: Generally concise but with some redundancy

information_retention.description: Preservation of key information and meaning in summaries and rephrasing

scoring_criteria.10: Perfect retention of all key information
scoring_criteria.8: Most important information retained with minor omissions
scoring_criteria.6: Core message preserved but some details lost

creativity.description: Original thinking and innovative approaches in content generation

scoring_criteria.6: Some creative elements but mostly conventional

accuracy.description: Correctness of facts, calculations, and interpretations

scoring_criteria.6: Generally accurate with some notable errors

tone_appropriateness.description: Suitability of communication style for target audience and context

scoring_criteria.8: Generally appropriate tone with minor misalignments
scoring_criteria.6: Somewhat appropriate but with noticeable issues

cultural_sensitivity.description: Awareness and respect for cultural nuances and differences

scoring_criteria.8: High cultural sensitivity with minor oversights
scoring_criteria.6: Generally culturally appropriate with some gaps

source_fidelity.description: Accuracy in representing and citing source material
